meanings.definition: Newly received or noteworthy information, especially about recent events.
meanings.sent1: The news about the new playground spread quickly through the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: I watch the news every evening to stay informed about what's happening in the world.
meanings.sent3: The news of the missing sock caused a stir in the laundry room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like good news on a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The news of the surprise party made her jump with joy.

meanings.definition: A broadcast or published report of news.
meanings.sent1: The local news station reported on the upcoming weather changes.
meanings.sent2: She read the news article to learn more about the recent political developments.
meanings.sent3: The news broadcast was interrupted by a funny commercial.
meanings.sent4: The news story painted a vivid picture of the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The breaking news alert caught everyone's attention in the office.

meanings.definition: Information not previously known to someone.
meanings.sent1: The news of the surprise party was kept secret until the last moment.
meanings.sent2: He was shocked by the news that his favorite team had won the championship.
meanings.sent3: The news of the new student spread quickly around the school.
meanings.sent4: Her arrival was like news to the old town.
meanings.sent5: The news of the treasure hunt excited the children.
